page.title: 15CHURCHES BASILDON/PANGBOURNE
page.content: {St. Bartholomew's Church,}Lower Basildon closed in 1973 as the centre of population changed to Lower Basildon. It had been the Parish church for 600 years. This year the Berkshire History Society is organising a survey of the monuments and graves. {St. Mary's Church }Whitchurch. This church is on the other side of the river, and is the oldest in the block, although extensively restored by the Victorians in 1856. On the South side it has a large Saxon doorway and above it a Saxon gargoyle. All the churches mentioned so far have been Anglican.{St. Bernadette's at Pangbourne serves the Roman Catholic community. The priest at this church is centred at the Abbey at Douai. There is also{a United Reformed Church at Pangsourne.
